channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5935] intermittent ServerModel LinkageError when connecting to ssh container
item.description:
There is some class loading issue - when from Fabric -> Containers user tries to connect to ssh container.

Unfortunatelly we don't have exact reproducer.
It happens often when we have 3 member ensemble and connecting to ssh container.
The issue usually disappears when ssh container is restarted.

Hawtio shows Cannot Connect: org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel

There is following error in ssh container log:tail

2016-08-02 06:44:22,393 | WARN  | qtp628170494-125 | HttpChannel                      | 107 - org.eclipse.jetty.util - 9.2.17.v20160517 | /auth/login/
 
java.lang.LinkageError: org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.JettyServerHandlerCollection.handle(JettyServerHandlerCollection.java:65)
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.HandlerWrapper.handle(HandlerWrapper.java:97)[104:org.eclipse.jetty.server:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server.handle(Server.java:499)[104:org.eclipse.jetty.server:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.HttpChannel.handle(HttpChannel.java:311)[104:org.eclipse.jetty.server:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.HttpConnection.onFillable(HttpConnection.java:257)[104:org.eclipse.jetty.server:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.io.AbstractConnection$2.run(AbstractConnection.java:544)[97:org.eclipse.jetty.io:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.QueuedThreadPool.runJob(QueuedThreadPool.java:635)[107:org.eclipse.jetty.util:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.QueuedThreadPool$3.run(QueuedThreadPool.java:555)[107:org.eclipse.jetty.util:9.2.17.v20160517]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_65]

Here's output of find-class command

Fabric8:fafram@ssh-container-name > find-class ServerModel
 
 
 
OPS4J Pax Web - Service SPI (126)
 
org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel$UrlPattern.class
 
org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel.class
 
 
 
OPS4J Pax Web - Runtime (127)
 
org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel$UrlPattern.class
 
org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel.class
 
 
 
OPS4J Pax Web - Jetty (128)
 
org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel$UrlPattern.class
 
org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel.class
 
 
 
Fabric8:fafram@okw-outbound2> osgi:list -t 0 -l | grep "(126|127|128)"
 
[ 126] [Active     ] [            ] [       ] [   30] mvn:org.ops4j.pax.web/pax-web-spi/4.2.7
 
[ 127] [Active     ] [            ] [       ] [   30] mvn:org.ops4j.pax.web/pax-web-runtime/4.2.7
 
[ 128] [Active     ] [            ] [       ] [   30] mvn:org.ops4j.pax.web/pax-web-jetty/4.2.7

LinkageError keeps popping up in log while hawtio tab with
Cannot Connect: org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel
remains open. See log-tail.txt
item.summary: intermittent ServerModel LinkageError when connecting to ssh container

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: osgi:find-class is a bit misleading. This class is not contained/exported from 3 bundles. It's found in 3 org.osgi.framework.wiring.BundleWiring instances that actually lead to the same org.osgi.framework.wiring.BundleRevision.

The indirect reason of this error is refresh of packages.

At root, everything's simpler:

Bundles to refresh:
 
  activemq-karaf / 5.11.0.redhat-630167 (Wired to org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi/5.11.0.redhat-630167 which is being refreshed)

At SSH container, pax-web-jsp bundle is uninstalled, which causes refresh of remaining pax-web bundles.

Grzegorz Grzybek nice catch !
Is it possible that github issue above (https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/issues/851) is root cause of ENTESB-5639 ? (CC Tadayoshi Sato)

Finally an explanation!

I was doing memory dump analysis and found two different classloaders (org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.BundleClassLoaderJava5) related to pax-web-spi bundle (from which org.ops4j.pax.web.service.spi.model.ServerModel class comes).

This itself isn't that bad, because when bundle is refreshed (without updating), existing BundleWiring is changed. The problem was that this class, loaded by previous instance of relevant class loader was used by JettyServerHandlerCollection - the handler for entire jetty server managed by pax-web.

LinkageError occurs when a class' reference and actual dependent class are related to the same initiating class loader. The problematic situation was that refresh (related to applying a profile to SSH container just being created) caused rewiring of pax-web bundles, but not jetty bundles.

At the start of HTTP request handling we have Jetty classes/methods (in order of dependency):

  • org.eclipse.jetty.io.SelectorManager.ManagedSelector#run() - selects keys for available NIO operations
  • org.eclipse.jetty.server.ServerConnector.ServerConnectorManager#accepted() - called when connection is made to server. SelectChannelEndPoint is created to handle the connection and org.eclipse.jetty.server.HttpConnection object to represent the connection
  • org.eclipse.jetty.io.SelectChannelEndPoint#onSelected() - called when there's data to be processed
  • org.eclipse.jetty.server.HttpConnection#onFillable() - called after the connection transitions to state where data can be processed
  • org.eclipse.jetty.server.HttpChannel#handle() - start handling of connection after HTTP headers have been parsed and data may be read (or EOF during GET)
  • org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server#handle() - handle connection at server level - this goes up to servlets/filters/webapps

HttpChannel#handle() passes connection to be handled by server, where server is taken from org.eclipse.jetty.server.HttpChannel#_connector. ServerConnector, which manages ServerConnectorManager is created by pax-web, so we have a kind of loop here - selectors, acceptors, threads, http connections reference an object created by pax-web.

pax-web, by default creates org.eclipse.jetty.jmx.MBeanContainer and adds it as bean to jetty server. But Jetty 9 did some refactoring to this class, which is no longer extending org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle - thus it isn't tied to server's lifecycle. I filled https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/issues/851 ticked which was kindly resolved by Jetty guys, so now (in not yet released Jetty version), MBeanContainer implements Destroyable.
The problem with the above is that MBeans registered during single cycle of pax-web/jetty server were not unregistered.

Here's how it looked like in simple scenario where SSH container was created and added to ensemble:

After a fix (actually from Tadayoshi Sato: https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXWEB-1001) it was better:

Multiple instances of ServerConnector were hanging deep inside JMX code and kept references to bundle classloaders.

Reopening the issue because
java.lang.LinkageError: org/ops4j/pax/web/service/spi/model/ServerModel
was spotted again on fuse 6.3 build #175

Log file: fuse630175-ensemble-member.log

My OQL query detected:

this     - value: org.eclipse.jetty.server.ServerConnector #2
 
 <- httpConnector     - class: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.ServerControllerImpl, value: org.eclipse.jetty.server.ServerConnector #2
 
  <- serverController     - class: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.Activator, value: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.ServerControllerImpl #1
 
   <- m_activator     - class: org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl, value: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.Activator #1
 
    <- [8]     - class: java.lang.Object[], value: org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl #96
 
     <- elementData     - class: java.util.ArrayList, value: java.lang.Object[] #13998
 
      <- bundles     - class: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.spi.util.ResourceDelegatingBundleClassLoader, value: java.util.ArrayList #13469
 
       <- contextClassLoader (thread object)     - class: java.lang.Thread, value: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.spi.util.ResourceDelegatingBundleClassLoader #3

and the Thread in question has name "org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.LateInvalidatingHashSessionManager@68f6cbbdTimer" - so another jetty/pax-web bug...

Command used to fetch heap dump

jmap -dump:live,format=b,file=file_with.dump PID

"HashSessionManager memory leak" details

CM thread starts Jetty's session manager during update of org.apache.cxf.osgi PID

"CM Configuration Updater (ManagedService Update: pid=[org.apache.cxf.osgi])@3042" daemon prio=5 tid=0x16 nid=NA runnable
 
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.server.session.AbstractSessionManager.doStart(AbstractSessionManager.java:245)
 
	  - locked <0x195f> (a org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.JettyServerWrapper)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.server.session.HashSessionManager.doStart(HashSessionManager.java:153)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68)
 
	  - locked <0x1d50> (a java.lang.Object)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.start(ContainerLifeCycle.java:132)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.doStart(ContainerLifeCycle.java:114)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler.doStart(AbstractHandler.java:61)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ScopedHandler.doStart(ScopedHandler.java:120)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.server.session.SessionHandler.doStart(SessionHandler.java:116)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:68)
 
	  - locked <0x1d6e> (a java.lang.Object)
 
	  at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle.start(ContainerLifeCycle.java:132)

	  at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandler.doStart(ContextHandler.java:741)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.HttpServiceContext.doStart(HttpServiceContext.java:249)

	  - locked <0x1a7c> (a java.lang.Object)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.JettyServerImpl$1.start(JettyServerImpl.java:279)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceStarted.registerServlet(HttpServiceStarted.java:221)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceStarted.registerServlet(HttpServiceStarted.java:195)

	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceProxy.registerServlet(HttpServiceProxy.java:64)
 
	  at org.apache.cxf.transport.http.osgi.ServletExporter.updated(ServletExporter.java:108)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.cm.impl.helper.ManagedServiceTracker.updated(ManagedServiceTracker.java:189)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.cm.impl.helper.ManagedServiceTracker.updateService(ManagedServiceTracker.java:152)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.cm.impl.helper.ManagedServiceTracker.provideConfiguration(ManagedServiceTracker.java:85)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.cm.impl.ConfigurationManager$ManagedServiceUpdate.provide(ConfigurationManager.java:1440)

	  at org.apache.felix.cm.impl.UpdateThread.run(UpdateThread.java:103)
 
	  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

Jetty's org.eclipse.jetty.server.SessionManager is actually org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.LateInvalidatingHashSessionManager and when it's started, it calls org.eclipse.jetty.server.session.HashSessionManager#setScavengePeriod() which schedules a scavenger thread. The timer (org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.Scheduler → org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.ScheduledExecutorScheduler) is created just a moment earlier and it's java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory creates threads with TCCL set. and the TCCL is taken from ... TCCL available when LateInvalidatingHashSessionManager was created, which was actually this one:

ResourceDelegatingBundleClassLoader{bundle=org.apache.cxf.cxf-rt-transports-http [118],parent=BundleClassLoader{bundle=org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-jetty [117],parent=null}}

so until ... oh my....

I see that threads created inside LateInvalidatingHashSessionManager (actually in Jetty, not in pax-web) are daemons by default and the scheduler is never explicitly stopped when hash manager stops! so that's the reason of:

$ grep -A2 Invalidating x
 
"org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.LateInvalidatingHashSessionManager@786edc5eTimer" #752 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f079c8cb800 nid=0x3734 waiting on condition [0x00007f07708dc000]
 
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
 
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
 
--

Resolved mainly with this commit by upgrading to pax-web 4.3.0 and jetty 9.2.19.

I went through heap dumps from ~100 containers after Roman's test and didn't find any mentions of ServerModel - fuse 6.3 build 187.
This issue should be resolved.
